intro: Microsisymbrium lasiophyllum var. dissectum, commonly known as the dissected leafed microsisymbrium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical legume structure and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is distinguished by its finely dissected, fern-like leaves that give it a unique, almost lace-like appearance. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pale blue or white, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its limited habitat and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
